Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact DCWL Manager at 517-899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section
Description The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth E was touched inappropriately, sexually harassed, and hit
by another youth implying inadequate supervision. Complainant
notified law enforcement.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant, also Rights Officer on 1/30/24. He
said Youth E uses they/them pronouns. Later Youth E stated a
preference for he/him pronouns.
Rights Officer said Youth E resides in Freedom Hall and the other
youth (Youth K) resides in DeRoy Hall. To his knowledge, the
youths only see each other occasionally at Clara B Ford School
on campus, campus events and “Dream Group” held in the
campus-shared gymnasium. Rights Officer said Youth E told him
he has been harassed by Youth K for the past two months. Youth
E could not remember where, when or what staff were supervising
when the harassment occurred. Rights Officer said Youth E only
identified one specific incident that occurred on 1/24/24 in the
shared gym during “Dream Group.” There, he told Rights Officer
Youth K touched his thigh under a table where they were sitting
together. Rights Officer reported the allegation to local law
enforcement.
I notified Youth E’s and Youth K’s MDHHS Workers of the
investigation. They expressed no additional concerns.
I collaborated with Government Worker 1, and it was decided we
would not move forward with interviews without permission from
law enforcement. Law enforcement approved us moving forward
with interviews on 1/31/24.
2

I interviewed Youth E jointly with Government Worker 1 on 2/1/24.
He has been at the facility for six months and provided vague and
conflicting information regarding the allegation. Youth E identified
being “sexually abused” but did not describe any behaviors that
would be considered sexual abuse. He said he was “touched on
the leg” but was nonspecific regarding where on his leg or in what
context he was touched. He referred to “sexual talk” but did not
describe the words said to him that were sexually provocative or
inappropriate.
Until a separation plan was developed on 1/29/24, Youth E said
he and Youth K saw each other in the cafeteria, the “Dream
Group” and in class at the charter school on campus. He said
there are “always staff all over” supervising.
Youth E stated Youth K “asked him out” once and he refused.
“We were acquaintances. I didn’t like her like that…In November
2023, she’d touch me, and I’d move her hand… Youth K touches
me, talks sexual and walks away. (In class) She did it sneakily.
(In the Dream Group) She hit me in the back of the head after I
moved her hand. No one saw.” Sometimes the touches
happened under tables. “Youth K was trying to get my attention.”
Youth E said a number of times he wanted to tell staff that Youth
K “touched” him and “hit the back of his head,” but he did not tell
anyone until recently because “Youth K told me she’d touch me
more if I told anyone.” On 12/21/24 Youth E finally told Staff 1 that
Youth K touched his thigh at school, and he felt uncomfortable,
but he did not tell Staff 1 when this occurred.
I interviewed Youth K jointly with Government Worker 1. She has
been at the facility for three months. Youth K said she has trust
issues and made a mistake befriending Youth E. “We got a
separation plan. I found out Youth E told other kids and now they
are calling me a rapist.” she explained. Youth K denied ever
touching Youth E inappropriately, hitting him or sexually harassing
him. She said the only physical contact the two had were hugs
and fist bumps.
Youth K said she and Youth E were in a class at school together
and sat next to one another in assigned seats. Sometimes in the
“Dream Group,” they chose to sit together at round tables. Asked
about staff supervision in the “Dream Group,” Youth K said youths
sit about three feet apart and staff sit or stand at the exit doors or
along the room’s perimeter. “There are eyes everywhere!” she
announced.
3

Toward the end of the interview, Youth K confessed that at one
time, she did have a “crush” on Youth E and suggested they get
together post-discharge.
Documents reviewed:
There were no incident reports indicating Youth E and Youth K
were ever observed by staff touching, hitting, or otherwise acting
inappropriately.
Government Worker had no findings.
Analysis Other than Youth E’s own report, there is no evidence Youth K
touched Youth E’s leg inappropriately or hit the back of his head
during “Dream Group.” There is also no evidence that staff failed
to supervise the spaces shared by the two youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 did not write an incident report on 12/21/23 prior to the end
of her shift per Vista Maria's incident report policy.
Investigation Documents reviewed:
An unprocessed incident report by Staff 1 dated 12/29/23
indicated Youth E told Staff 1 on 12/21/23 that Youth K was
rubbing her thigh in class, and it made her uncomfortable.
I reviewed Vista Maria’s incident report writing policy. The policy
indicates staff are to complete an incident report and inform the
shift supervisor of report completion before end of their shift.
Interview:
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker and Rights
Officer. She has worked at the facility for ten months. Staff 1 said
a month ago, Youth E informed her Youth K touched his leg and it
was uncomfortable. On another date she said Youth E returned
4

from school and casually announced, “She did it again.” Staff 1
did not ask Youth E who he was referring to or what was done
again. Staff 1 recalled Former Therapist came to her after Youth
E told Therapist that someone from Freedom Hall assaulted her.
Staff 1 said Therapist thought she knew the name of the youth
who assaulted Youth E, but Staff 1 said she did not know of a
youth from Freedom Hall because Youth K is in DeRoy Hall. It
seems Former Therapist had inaccurate information which caused
a miscommunication between herself and Staff 1.
Analysis Staff 1 did not follow Vista Maria’s policy for writing incident
reports and notifying the supervisor prior to the end of the shift.
Not only was her incident report 8 days late, but it was not process
through the proper channels because the supervisor notification
box was not checked on the form.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter
Section care institutions: updated treatment plan.
Description
(3) The updated treatment plan shall include all of the following
information:
(c) Changes in the treatment plan, including new problems and
new goals to remedy the problems. Indicators of goal achievement
and time frames for achievement shall be specified along with a
specific behavior management plan designed to minimize
seclusion and restraint and that includes a continuum of
responses to problem behaviors.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Changes in the treatment plan including new problems such as
the need to separate Youth E and Youth K were not identified and
addressed in a timely manner.
Investigation Documents reviewed:
An incident report by Former Therapist dated 12/27/23 indicated
Youth E alleged he was “sexually abused” at Vista Maria and had
identified the abuser to Staff 1. He told Therapist he did not want
to discuss it, would handle it himself and stormed out of the
therapy session. Therapist contacted the Social Service
Supervisor and discussed the incident with Staff 1. Staff 1 stated
5

Youth E told her a peer in another building touched his leg and
she wrote an incident report. Therapist notified Youth E’s MDHHS
Worker by phone and email.
After Youth E filed a grievance, separation plans dated 1/29/24
were developed for Youth E and Youth K. I reviewed the written
plans which are specific behavior management plans considered
as an extension of the treatment plan.
Interview:
Former Therapist resigned on 1/19/24. On 2/6/24, Government
Worker 1 and I attempted to reach her by phone. A voice
message was left.
Staff 1 said she became aware of the thigh touching allegation on
12/21/24.
Rights Officer stated Youth E and Youth K continued to attend
class and/or Dream Group together until 1/24/24.
Analysis Staff 1 said she became aware of the thigh touching allegation on
12/21/24 and an incident report by Former Therapist indicated she
notified MDHHS Worker and Social Service Supervisor of the
allegation on 12/27/23, but no separation plan was developed.
Youth E and Youth K continued to attend class and Dream Group
together until 1/24/24 when Youth E filed a grievance. Rights
Officer reported the allegation to centralized intake and law
enforcement and separation plans were put in place on 1/29/24.
The separation plans should have been implemented in late
December when the allegation was first made.
The facility did not develop the youths’ behavior management
plans which are extensions of the treatment plan in a timely
manner.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
